materials.raw_text: Co: 192 g; Nd: 48 g; P: 120 g; Sm: 24 g; Tc: 24 g

sourcing.instructions: Co: Metal suppliers or online alloy vendors; Nd: Rare earth material suppliers; P: Chemical supply companies; Sm: Rare earth suppliers; Tc: Specialized nuclear material suppliers (ensure compliance with regulations).
steps: Co: Metal suppliers or online alloy vendors; Nd: Rare earth material suppliers; P: Chemical supply companies; Sm: Rare earth suppliers; Tc: Specialized nuclear material suppliers (ensure compliance with regulations).

1. Weigh each material precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean environment, mix Co, Nd, P, Sm, and Tc in a large ceramic or glass container. 3. Use a pestle and mortar to achieve a fine powder consistency. 4. Ensure thorough mixing to achieve uniform distribution of each element.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each material precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean environment, mix Co, Nd, P, Sm, and Tc in a large ceramic or glass container. 3. Use a pestle and mortar to achieve a fine powder consistency. 4. Ensure thorough mixing to achieve uniform distribution of each element.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Heat in a high-temperature furnace to 1200 °C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction and alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Heat in a high-temperature furnace to 1200 °C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction and alloy formation.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool gradually to room temperature (approximately 3-4 hours). 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool gradually to room temperature (approximately 3-4 hours). 2. Avoid rapid cooling to prevent cracking.

steps: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Grind the edges to achieve desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches) using a bench grinder. 3. Clean the surface with isopropyl alcohol to remove any remaining residues. 4. Optionally seal with a protective coating if required for environmental stability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Grind the edges to achieve desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches) using a bench grinder. 3. Clean the surface with isopropyl alcohol to remove any remaining residues. 4. Optionally seal with a protective coating if required for environmental stability.
